required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implantable System for Remodulin Post-Approval Study
clinical_study.official_title: Implantable System for Remodulin Post-Approval Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Implantable System for Remodulin (ISR) Post Approval Study (PAS) is to provide evaluation and periodic reporting of the safety and effectiveness of Medtronic market-released ISR, including the catheter and the pump.

detailed_description.textblock: The ISR PAS is an observational, prospective, non-randomized, multi-center study. It will enroll a minimum of 50 newly implanted patients at up to 10 US sites, observing and reporting catheter-related complications and pump failures through 5 years post implant.

primary_outcome.description: Number of adverse events requiring invasive intervention that are related to the ISR catheter.
Number of adverse events requiring invasive intervention that are related to the ISR pump.

intervention.description: All patients will be implanted with the Implantable System for Remodulin (treprostinil).

study_pop.textblock: Newly implanted patients that are intended to receive an ISR.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject or legally authorized representative provides written authorization and/or consent per institution and geographical requirements.
- Subject is intended to receive an eligible ISR product.
- Subject is at least 22 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is pregnant.
- Subject who is expected to be inaccessible for follow-up.
- Subject with exclusion criteria required by local law.
- Subject is currently enrolled in or plans to enroll in any concurrent drug and/or device study that may confound results (i.e. no required intervention that could affect interpretation of all-around product safety and or effectiveness).
